name: sapha
short_description:
Sapha is a framework for binary analysis and instrumentation. It provides facilities to read and instrument binaries as well as do abstract interpretation-based analysis of such binaries. The binaries that are instrumented using Sapha have very low overhead.

Work on the Sapha tool (and project) is led by Hridesh Rajan from Iowa State University. Tyler Sondag during his PhD thesis worked on developing this tool and still continues to contribute to the project. 

This material is based upon work supported by the National Science Foundation under Grant No. 1117937. Any opinions, findings, and conclusions or recommendations expressed in this material are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the National Science Foundation.
summary: Sapha is a framework for binary analysis and instrumentation.
